content: Hotel Transylvania is a monster themed hotel chain founded by Count Dracula in 1897 as a safe, welcoming place for creatures traveling among humans. Today, all locations keep that same promise: comfort, privacy, and a little nocturnal charm.

Standard check in requires a government issued photo ID or an equivalent monster credential, plus a valid payment method for incidentals. If you are checking in under a different name, the primary guest must add you to the reservation before arrival.

Cancellation is free with at least 24 hours notice prior to your scheduled check in time. Cancellations inside 24 hours may be charged one night room and tax, unless you have a nonrefundable promotional rate.

We accept all major credit and debit cards, including contactless payment. For traditional travelers, we also accept verified gold coins and appraised ancient treasures, which are valued at check in and documented on your folio.

A refundable incidental hold is placed at check in to cover extras like dining charges, spa services, or accidental claw marks. The hold amount depends on room type and length of stay, and it is released after checkout once the room is cleared.

Our pet policy is friendly to unusual companions, including dragons, griffins, and three headed dogs, as long as they are supervised in public areas. Fire breathing pets must be registered at check in so we can provide a spark safe room setup.

If your pet breathes fire, we provide heat resistant bedding, a stone water bowl, and a fire safety walkthrough. For everyone’s comfort, open flame tricks are not allowed in hallways, elevators, or near drapes.
All locations offer complimentary WiFi in guestrooms and common areas. If you need higher bandwidth for streaming, gaming, or coven meetings, ask the front desk about premium speed upgrades.
Every hotel has a heated or cooled pool depending on the season, plus a gym and spa. Pool temperature can be adjusted for cold blooded guests on request, within safe limits.
Housekeeping is available daily unless you request privacy. Services include coffin turndown, web dusting for spider guests, and fresh towel restocking for mummies who prefer extra wraps.
Coffin cleaning is offered as a standard amenity for Coffin Suites and any room with a coffin bed setup. If you bring your own coffin, we can provide lining refresh and polish as an add on service.

Dining is designed for monster diets, with blood type room service options, a clearly labeled garlic free menu, and allergy notes for silver sensitivity. Midnight snacks are available nightly from 11:00 PM to 2:00 AM in the lobby lounge.

If you need blood type room service, you can choose from O, A, B, or AB options, plus a synthetic blend for ethical dining preferences. Orders are discreetly delivered in temperature controlled flasks.

All restaurants and room service can prepare meals without garlic on request, and garlic is never used as a garnish. If you have additional sensitivities, tell us at ordering so we can flag the kitchen.

Safety protocols include special fire precautions for dragon guests, including designated cooling zones and nonflammable hallway runners. Our staff are trained to handle minor scorch events calmly and quickly.

Rooms are silver free by default to protect werewolves and other silver sensitive guests. If you require silver for personal reasons, we can place you in a designated silver safe room that is separated from standard floors.

Kids under 12 stay free when sharing a room with an adult, using existing bedding. Teen guests can join our teen vampire programs, which include supervised night activities and optional daylight safety training.

If you are traveling with a teen vampire, we recommend registering their program schedule at check in so staff can coordinate curfew preferences. Programs are designed to be fun and safe, with quiet hours respected for other guests.

Quiet hours are observed nightly from 10:00 PM to 7:00 AM across all locations. Howling, thunderous stomping, and dramatic cape swooshing are welcome earlier, but please keep it gentle during quiet hours.

The Fang Club loyalty program lets you earn points on room stays, dining, and spa services. Tiers include Fresh Fang, Night Stalker, and Elder, with benefits like late checkout when available and complimentary midnight snacks at higher tiers.

Fang Club points typically post within 48 hours after checkout, and you can redeem points for free nights or upgrades when available. If points are missing, contact support with your confirmation number and checkout date.

Spa services vary by location but commonly include fang whitening, fur grooming, and wing massage. If you have delicate scales or brittle bones, tell the spa in advance so they can tailor the treatment.

Our business center is available for corporate monsters and includes printing, scanning, secure WiFi, and private meeting booths. If you need an after hours session, the front desk can provide access based on availability.

We host weddings and events with monster themed packages, including a Howling at the Moon ceremony option and custom menu planning. Event teams can coordinate lighting and sound for sensitive guests, like vampires and banshees.
For corporate or general help, call 1 800 DRACULA to reach our central support line. They can assist with reservations, Fang Club questions, and connecting you to any location’s front desk.

Late checkout is available upon request at all locations, but it is not guaranteed and depends on same day occupancy. Fang Club Elder tier members receive priority consideration when requesting late checkout.
Early check in requests are handled on a first come basis on the day of arrival. While we cannot guarantee early access, luggage storage and access to common areas are always available.
Smoking is not permitted in guestrooms or indoor public spaces, including magical smoke and potion fumes. Designated outdoor smoking areas are available and clearly marked at each property.

If a guest accidentally triggers supernatural activity such as levitation or wall crawling, please notify the front desk immediately. Our maintenance team is trained to reset enchanted fixtures safely.
All locations comply with modern accessibility standards while preserving historic charm. Wheelchair accessible rooms, elevators, and bathrooms are available upon request.

Guests who require total darkness during daytime hours may request blackout sealing, including door light blockers and window edge covers. This service is complimentary and typically installed within 20 minutes.
Laundry and dry cleaning services are available at all locations, including special care for capes, cloaks, and enchanted fabrics. Same day service is offered when items are submitted before 9:00 AM.
If you lose a personal item during your stay, contact the front desk or corporate support as soon as possible. Lost items are logged and stored securely for up to 30 days.
Room service is available late night at all properties, with limited overnight menus between 2:00 AM and 6:00 AM. Beverage service remains available 24 hours for registered guests.
Mini bars are stocked with blood substitutes, mineral water, and regionally inspired snacks. If you prefer a custom mini bar setup, request it at least 24 hours before arrival.
For guest safety, windows are sealed beyond a certain opening limit. Flying guests may request supervised rooftop access where permitted by local regulations.
All emergency exits are clearly marked and enchanted to remain visible in darkness, smoke, or magical fog. In case of evacuation, follow illuminated claw print indicators along the floor.
Guests are responsible for supervising their pets at all times, including in elevators and public spaces. Repeated aggressive behavior may result in relocation to a pet friendly isolation wing.
Currency exchange services are available for major world currencies and select ancient forms of payment. Exchange rates are posted daily at the front desk.
If you are celebrating a birthday, rebirth, or full moon milestone, notify the front desk and we can arrange a small in room surprise. Advance notice is recommended for custom requests.

All locations require guests to be at least 18 years old to check in, unless accompanied by a parent or legal guardian. If the reservation is booked by someone else, the adult checking in must present ID and a matching payment method.
We can store luggage before check in and after check out at no charge for same day retrieval. If you need multi day storage, ask the front desk about extended storage availability and fees.
If you arrive before your room is ready, you may use lobby seating, restrooms, and designated quiet corners. Some amenities like the pool and gym may be available early depending on crowd levels.
All rooms include a safe for valuables such as jewelry, spell books, and small ancient relics. The hotel is not responsible for items left unattended outside the in room safe.

If you need a wake up call, we offer both standard phone calls and a gentle bat knock option for guests who prefer quieter notifications. Wake up requests can be scheduled at the front desk or through in room messaging.

All properties offer contactless check out via text or front desk, with an emailed receipt available on request. If you paid with treasures or coins, a final appraisal statement is included on your folio.
Noise complaints are handled discreetly to protect guest privacy. Staff may request the noisy room reduce volume, and repeated issues can lead to relocation or removal from event areas.
If you need a quiet room, you can request placement away from elevators, ice machines, and event spaces. Quiet room placement is based on availability and is easier to guarantee with advance notice.

All hotels provide fresh linens and towels, including extra durable options for guests with claws or talons. If your linens are damaged accidentally, notify housekeeping so we can replace them quickly.
For guests with wings, we offer wing friendly chairs in common areas and wider pathway guidance in busy spaces. If you need extra room in your guestroom, ask about wing clearance room setups.
If a guest is injured, staff can provide basic first aid and call local emergency services. For non urgent medical needs, we can recommend nearby urgent care options and pharmacies.
If you are allergic to common human cleaning products, request a hypoallergenic cleaning option. This includes fragrance free soap, low irritant sprays, and reduced aerosol use.
All properties offer a limited supply of baby items like portable cribs, bottle warmers, and high chairs. Request these in advance because availability can be limited during peak weekends.
If you need two adjoining rooms, request connecting rooms when booking. Connecting rooms are subject to availability and may require booking the same room category on both sides.
If you forget a charger, toothbrush, or basic travel item, the front desk maintains a limited supply of essentials. Some items are complimentary, while others may be billed to your room.

For guests working remotely, most rooms include a desk and chair setup, and the business center offers quiet work booths. If you need a larger screen or printing support, ask the front desk for options.

All hotels have a safety policy against bringing silver weapons, open flames, or unregistered potions into common areas. If you are traveling with special items for cultural reasons, notify the front desk for safe storage options.
If you plan to arrive after midnight, please call ahead so we can hold your reservation and prepare for a quick check in. Late arrival notes help us reduce wait time at the desk.
All locations can arrange airport transfers through trusted partners. Prices vary by city and time of day, and the concierge can provide an exact quote before booking.
If you are traveling for a wedding or event, you can request a room block rate when booking multiple rooms. Room blocks typically require advance notice and a minimum number of rooms.

Our event menus can accommodate garlic free, gluten free, and vegetarian preferences, including synthetic blood beverage options. Final menu selections are typically confirmed at least 7 days before the event date.

If you need a private ritual or quiet reflection space, ask the front desk about reserving a small room during off peak hours. We aim to support cultural practices as long as they remain safe and respectful.
For guests concerned about privacy, we can disable name display on public room delivery labels and use a discreet code instead. Please request this at check in for all deliveries and room service.
If you receive packages, the front desk can accept them for registered guests, but large shipments may require advance approval. Perishable items should be labeled clearly and retrieved promptly.
All locations maintain a garlic free baseline in kitchens, but we still recommend guests communicate allergies clearly. Cross contact cannot be fully eliminated, especially in shared prep areas.

If your room temperature feels off, we can adjust HVAC settings or provide a portable unit depending on the property. Cold blooded guests may request warmer ranges, while ice creatures may request cooler ranges.

If you are traveling with a service animal, it is always welcome and does not count against pet limits. Emotional support animals follow local laws and may require documentation depending on the city.

Guests may request feather free pillows, extra firm coffins, or softer crypt bedding depending on preference. Bedding choices are subject to availability but we try to honor requests whenever possible.
If you are planning a proposal, the concierge can help coordinate timing, room setup, and a discreet photographer. We recommend scheduling at least 48 hours in advance for smooth coordination.
If you misplace your key card, replacement cards are available at the front desk after verifying your ID. For privacy, we will not issue a replacement to anyone not listed on the room.

If you prefer minimal staff interaction, you may request a low contact stay, which limits housekeeping knock attempts and front desk outreach. This option is useful for guests who value privacy or rest during daylight hours.
Guests may opt out of daily housekeeping and receive fresh towels and amenities on request instead. This option supports both privacy and sustainability initiatives across all locations.
If you are sensitive to mirrors, you may request mirror covers or reduced reflective surfaces in your room. Availability varies by room type, but staff will do their best to accommodate.
All locations offer complimentary filtered water refill stations on each guest floor. Guests who prefer bottled options may request glass bottled water delivery to their room.
If you are traveling with fragile artifacts or heirlooms, the front desk can arrange temporary secure storage. Items are logged, sealed, and accessible only with guest verification.
Guests participating in overnight events may request delayed quiet hour enforcement on designated event floors only. All other floors continue to observe standard quiet hours.
If you are traveling across time zones, the concierge can help plan gradual schedule shifts to avoid daylight exposure fatigue. This service is complimentary and tailored to your itinerary.
Rooms are inspected after checkout for damage beyond normal wear. If damage is found, charges may apply, and the guest will be contacted with photo documentation.
If you need a temporary room extension due to travel delays, the front desk can quote an hourly or half day rate when availability allows. Extensions are not guaranteed during high occupancy.
For guests with hearing sensitivity, visual alerts can replace audible alarms in guestrooms. This includes light based wake up calls and emergency notifications.
If you are celebrating an anniversary or centuries long partnership, mention it at booking and we can note the occasion. Small acknowledgments may be arranged based on availability.
Guests may request scent free rooms, where cleaning products and amenities are selected to minimize fragrance. This is recommended for guests with scent sensitivity.
If a guest fails to check out by the confirmed time without approval, a late departure fee may apply. The front desk will attempt contact before applying any charges.
All properties maintain 24 hour security monitoring in public spaces. Guestroom corridors are accessible only by key card for added safety.
If you prefer not to be disturbed at all, you may activate extended privacy mode, which suppresses non essential staff visits. Emergency access is still retained for safety reasons.
For guests arriving by motorcycle, broomstick, or non standard transport, storage options may be available depending on location. Call ahead for guidance before arrival.
If you require a translator or interpreter, the concierge can arrange language support services with advance notice. Availability depends on language and time of day.
Rooms with fireplaces or heat stones are limited and must be requested in advance. These features are monitored for safety and may not be available for all pet types.
If you need to print boarding passes or travel documents, printing is available at the business center. Small print jobs are typically complimentary.
Guests who violate safety or conduct policies may be asked to relocate rooms or leave the property without refund. These situations are handled discreetly whenever possible.
